III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
Holy Cross-Queen of Angels is an open facility with 16 acres of land. The facility
is located at 3400 S. Washington, Saginaw, MI 48858. The facility is well
maintained and has updated flooring and furniture. Upon entrance there is a
foyer for visitors. Once past the entrance there is a long hallway to the right. This
hallway has 15 individual bedrooms. Each bedroom has a bed, dresser, and
nightstand as well as a window. In the room, is a heating register that does not
get hot to the touch. The doors are kept open by a magnetic device on the wall.
Each bedroom has a comforter and is inviting. Youth will be able to decorate their
room. In this hallway, there are three staff offices, a kitchenette with all working
appliances, a small dining room, laundry room, living room, therapy and group
room and storage. There are two other hallways that have the exact same rooms
and set up as well. The agency has a capacity of 45 bedrooms. Back to the
beginning of that hallway is a large recreational space. There is a fireplace in this
room, but it is boarded up and non-breakable glass covers it. There are tables in
the room. Past this room is the large dining room, possibly able to accommodate
all groups at once. The kitchen is off the dining room and is stocked with
supplies. Back out of the dining room is a hallway that leads to two large rooms
that could accommodate more beds, but at this time has not been designated as
any particular purpose. The last hallway leads to a large recreational room with a
pool table and movie screen. This room leads into the chapel/multipurpose room.
3

Outside the facility is a walking path, basketball court, fishing pond, disc golf and
space that can be used for other outdoor recreation.
The Fire Inspection was completed on 12/28/23 an received and “A” rating.
The Health Inspection was completed on 12/20/23 and received an “A” rating.
B. Program Description
The program statement has been reviewed and the following information has
been summarized to detail the program statement:
The facility has three separate units that could be used, based on need; Jacob
Hall, Matthew Hall and Hope Hall. Each unit has its own hallway, as described in
the physical description of the facility, with 15 bedrooms. The rooms are set up
as single occupancy.
Queen of Angels-Jacob Hall is a Behavior Stabilization Program which serves
males who have emotional regulation behaviors that have impacted functional
areas of daily life, including relationships, school, family, or other areas that
services in the community are not effective in treating. Participants in this
program are 12 to 17 years old.
Queen of Angels-Matthew Hall is a Youth with Problematic Sexual Behaviors
Program which serves males who have sexual behaviors that have impacted
functional areas of daily life, including relationships, school, family, or other areas
that services in the community are not effective in treating. Participants in this
program are 12 to 17 years old.
Queen of Angels-Hope Hall is a Behavior Stabilization Program which serves
females who have emotional regulation behaviors that have impacted functional
areas of daily life, including relationships, school, family, or other areas that
services in the community are not effective in treating. Participants in this
program are 12 to 17 years old.
The structure and design of the programs allow for each participant to have
opportunities to interact in a daily 24/7 residential living environment while
maintaining a level of therapeutic independence within the group.
The agency utilizes Trauma Informed Dialectical Behavior Therapy (TI-DBT) in
their individual and group sessions and teach skills classes multiple times per
week. Individual and/or group therapy will be provided in accordance with the
participant’s treatment needs as identified in the participant’s treatment plan and
stipulations of court orders. Each participant will be provided with weekly
individual therapeutic services. Group therapy will be provided as an adjunct
treatment.
4

Holy Cross Services Psychiatrist will complete all psychiatric services including
evaluation, psychiatric consultation, and medication reviews. Prescriptions are
filled out by a contracted pharmaceutical company and delivered directly to
Queen of Angels.
The agency will utilize Crisis Prevention Institute (CPI) as their emergency
intervention techniques. All staff are trained on the physical and verbal de-
escalation techniques in this model. CPI refreshers are conducted annually.
Education services will be provided at a public school located in the Saginaw
School District. The school’s location is 925 N. River Rd. Youth will be bused
there daily by the facility.
Spiritual services will be provided to those youth who would like to participate.
The facility received medical and dental services through Great Lakes Bay
Health Center. There is one RN onsite and two other RNs at other locations.
Youth will be provided community service projects and recreation is provided
daily.
Therapeutic home visits are provided, and aftercare will be provided up to four
months after discharge. Staffing patterns are 1:3 during waking hours and 1:8
during sleeping hours. Holy Cross-Queen of Angels has staff employed at their
other licensed facilities and will be utilizing staff from these facilities to fulfil the
roles at this new facility.
All new employees will receive 50 hours of training within the first year and 25
hours annually in accordance with licensing rules.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
All policies and procedures have been reviewed and are in compliance with
licensing rules and statutes.
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on substantial compliance with the rules, it is recommended that a six-month
original license be issued.
